18149874.projn: CN-Daxing An Ling Forest Fire Reh -- P003550
18149874.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

repnme.cdata!:
China - Da Xing An Ling Forest Fire
            Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
In May 1987 the most disastrous forest
            fire in China's history burned about 870,000ha in the
            northern part of the Da Xing An Ling (DXAL) natural forest
            area. Quick action is now required to salvage high quality
            timber and to establish a fire protection system to avoid
            another major disaster in these important timber resources.
            The Daxinganling Forest Fire Rehabilitation Project will
            support an accelerated salvage program to recover about 14
            million cbm of dead timber of lumber quality.  The logs
            which cannot be immediately exported from the area will be
            stored in water. The project will also provide for the
            establishment of a comprehensive fire protection system
            covering the entire DXAL area. The program will focus on
            aerial and satellite fire detection and on aerial
            suppression measures. Research will be initiated on
            regeneration methods, nursery technology and silvicultural
            management. Technical assistance will be provided to support
            planning and implementation of project activities and to
            improve management of forest resources in the project area.
